intro: Malacocarpus crithmifolius, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers and silver-gray, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, thriving in sandy or rocky soils. It is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and coastal landscaping.
